reasons_to_visit.details: May in Santorini brings reliably sunny, warm days (average highs 24–26 °C) without the midsummer heat—ideal for exploring caldera villages and beaches.
The island’s vineyards and terraces burst with green shoots and colorful bougainvillea, making drives through Pyrgos and Megalochori especially scenic.
Caldera trails, Ancient Thera, and Akrotiri excavations are far less crowded than in June–August, so you can enjoy the ruins at your own pace.
Sea temperatures climb to 20–21 °C. Beaches like Perissa, Kamari, and Vlychada are open and welcoming, but still have plenty of space.
Sunset in Oia occurs around 8:15 PM, giving you long daylight hours for both daytime adventures and evening cliff‑side dinners.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Caldera Cruises & Volcano Tours Fully Operating
reasons_to_visit.details: All daily boat tours—including hot‑springs swims, volcano hikes, and sunset sails—run on full schedules by early May.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: May marks the start of high season: caldera‑view hotels, car rentals, and boat excursions book up quickly and rates increase.
UV is high; sunscreen, hats, and sunglasses are essential, especially for mid‑day activities.
Northerly caldera winds may begin to gust later in the month, affecting exposed hikes and small‑boat tours.
Night‑time lows drop to 17–18 °C—bring a light wrap for terrace dinners.
To secure cliff‑side tables, sunset cruises, and desirable rooms in Fira or Imerovigli, reserve several weeks ahead.

weather.precipitation: Virtually no rain; clear skies with gentle breezes off the caldera.
weather.general_tips: Pack lightweight layers, swimwear, high‑SPF sunscreen, wide‑brimmed hat, sunglasses, and a water bottle. A light sweater for breezy mornings/evenings.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderately busy—best to hit popular viewpoints early. Beaches fill by late morning but remain less crowded than June.
tourism_level.pricing: High‑season rates begin; occasional off‑peak discounts may still be found for early‑May stays.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Balanced: mornings for culture, afternoons for beach lounging, evenings for cliff‑side dining.

events_holidays.name: Protomagia (May Day)
events_holidays.description: Local wreath‑making and spring‑welcome traditions; many families picnic outdoors and some tavernas may close midday.
events_holidays.notes: Expect holiday crowds on beaches and in villages. Book restaurants in advance.

events_holidays.name: Daily Caldera Sunset Cruises
events_holidays.description: Sunset sailing tours depart from Ammoudi Bay and Athinios Port each evening.
events_holidays.notes: Book 7–10 days ahead for best availability.

unique_experiences.description: Arrive before dawn to watch the caldera glow without crowds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bring a headlamp and coffee; paths are rocky and dark pre‑sunrise.

unique_experiences.description: Tour the Bronze‑Age ruins at a leisurely pace before groups arrive.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive at opening (8 AM); pair with a visit to nearby Red Beach viewpoint.

unique_experiences.description: Sample Assyrtiko and Vinsanto wines on a terrace overlooking the caldera vineyards.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reserve in advance; small‑group tastings are most intimate.

unique_experiences.activity: Caldera‑Edge Walk from Fira to Imerovigli
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy sweeping views of Skaros Rock and the volcano path before midday sun.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear sturdy shoes; carry water and a hat; trail is unshaded.

weather.precipitation: No rain; days grow warmer and breezier along exposed clifftops.
weather.general_tips: Maintain strict sun protection and hydration. Plan strenuous activities for early morning or late afternoon.

tourism_level.crowds: High and rising—cliff‑side restaurants and sunset cruises book out quickly.
tourism_level.pricing: Rates stabilize at peak levels; last‑minute deals are rare.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Full spring‑to‑summer transition: lively beach bars, busy tavernas, and vibrant caldera evenings.

events_holidays.name: Oia Arts & Culture Evenings
events_holidays.description: Small‑scale concerts, gallery openings, and cultural performances in Oia’s historic venues.
events_holidays.notes: Schedules vary; ask your hotel or local café for details.

events_holidays.name: Daily Volcano & Hot Springs Tours
events_holidays.description: Guided boat excursions to Nea Kameni crater and Palea Kameni springs run twice daily.
events_holidays.notes: Morning departures are cooler and less crowded.

unique_experiences.description: Escape the crowds with a short ferry ride to tranquil Thirassia—explore its villages and seaside tavernas.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ferries run every 30–60 minutes; bring cash for small tavernas.

unique_experiences.description: Discover underwater rock formations and marine life in the sheltered cove beneath the red cliffs.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Access via short boat from Red Beach or by steep footpath; bring/rent snorkel gear.

unique_experiences.description: Climb to the castle ruins for a dramatic sunset view above the caldera—often quieter than Oia.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Start by 6 PM; wear sturdy shoes; carry water.

unique_experiences.description: Join evening DJ nights and themed events at the black‑sand beach bars.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check event schedules online; some parties have cover charges after 11 PM.
